revised_title: Fine Structure of Atmospheric Turbulence and its Impact on Sound Propagation
tldr: This study investigates the fine structure of atmospheric turbulence and its relation to sound propagation. The researchers measured wind fluctuations and correlated them with simultaneous sound intensity measurements to understand the impact of turbulence on sound propagation. The findings provide insights into the scale of turbulence and its effect on the phase relationships between signals picked up at different points.
